plot: Kenji Koiso, an eleventh grade math genius, agrees to take a summer job at the Nagano hometown of his crush, Natuski. When he arrives, he finds that her family have reunited to celebrate the 90th birthday of the family matriarch. His job is to pretend to be Natsuki's fiancé. Meanwhile, his attempt to solve a mathematical equation causes a parallel world's collision with earth.

m.role: Badass Grandpa: Mansuke (Kazuma's grandfather, filling this requirement) taught Kazuma (and thus King Kazma) everything he knows about martial arts, attacked Love Machine (by this time an extremely strong martial arts master) by himself to buy Kazma time to recover, and he has a NINJA SQUID for an avatar. He does it all on a Nintendo DS!
Cool Old Guy: Mansuke, who taught his reclusive gaming grandson martial arts to protect him from bullies.

f.role: Beauty Mark: Nana and Kana both have one under their right eye.
Cool Big Bro: It's implied that Kenji becomes this to Kazuma by the end.
Cool Old Lady: You do not pull a fast one on Granny Sakae. The only reason she died is because Love Machine's chaos had disabled Mansaku's heart monitoring equipment while she was sleeping.
Lady of War: Granny Sakae is certainly handy with a naginata.

Missing Mom: The mothers that are missing from the entire film: Kenji's mom. See Parental Abandonment. Shota's mom (the wife of Tasuke). The mother of Mansaku's three sons. Wabisuke's mom (the woman who had an affair with Granny Sakae's husband)
Never Mess with Granny: Grandma Sakae is a tough old broad.
Passionate Sports Woman: Implied to be this to Yumi because of her Red Sox jersey and how she cheers on her pitcher son, Ryohei.
Summer Wars: Grandma Sakae. Not only does she fit the build, running her extended family by traditional values, but she also wields a naginata with skill.
